title: Celebrate SG50 at Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
text:
"We are currently updating our website and doing maintenance. We apologize for the inconvenience." 3 Home » HOTEL NEWS » Celebrate SG50 at Mandarin Oriental, Singapore Celebrate SG50 at Mandarin Oriental, Singapore Published on : Thursday, July 2, 2015 
Stunningly located across The Float @ Marina Bay, Mandarin Oriental, Singapore, welcomes the nation’s golden jubilee amidst vibrant National Day Parade 2015 celebrations.Not only will guests enjoy a host of delectable dining delights at various restaurants, they will also have the opportunity to watch the much-anticipated fireworks display by the bay from the hotel’s outdoor harbour terrace on 9 August 2015. 

Look forward to a uniquely Singaporean feast at MELT ~ The World Café, where heritage hawker stalls will be set up, in addition to its regular buffet spread, offering popular local delicacies, such as Hainanese chicken rice, claypot bak kut teh, Katong laksa, Hokkien prawn noodle, rojak, popiah, and ice kachang just to name a few. Most importantly, there will also be a dedicated durian corner featuring the king of fruits for the perfect finale. 


Indulge in a delectable six-course dinner at Italian poolside restaurant Dolce Vita, consisting of tantalising appetisers, seafood and meats, then round up the meal with a special Majulah Singapura dessert of raspberry marmalade, vanilla almond sponge and lychee martini raspberry gelato. The outdoor pool lounge, BAY@5, will also be serving up an array of delicious small bites, including assorted cold cuts, oysters, meatballs, pizzas and more. 


Finally, savour authentic Cantonese cuisine at Cherry Garden, where the seven-course set dinner menu showcases the signature Peking duck and traditional condiments, golden pumpkin soup with morel mushroom and diced chicken, braised sliced abalone with vegetables, finished with a homemade organic black bean pudding topped with sesame ice cream to end the dinner on a sweet note.
